Name.BusinessNameLine1: ALLIANCE CHILDREN'S SERVICES INC FKA MENTOR INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: PROVIDE SPECIALIZED HEALTH AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES TO DEVELOPMENTALLY CHALLENGED.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE COMPANY SHALL PROMOTE AND PROVIDE SAFE, HEALTHY, QUALITY SERVICES AND LIVING ENVIRONMENTS FOR CHILDREN WHO CANNOT CARE FOR THEMSELVES.
IRS990.Description: ALLIANCE CHILDREN'S SERVICES, INC. PROVIDES FOSTER CARE SERVICES TO CHILDREN AND YOUTH WHO HAVE EMOTIONAL OR BEHAVIORAL DISORDERS, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, ARE MEDICALLY FRAGILE, OR ARE IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM. MOST OFTEN, THE CHILDREN WE SERVE HAVE BEEN SERVED UNSUCCESSFULLY IN HOMES IN OTHER AGENCIES, OR COME FROM MORE RESTRICTIVE SETTINGS, SUCH AS RESIDENTIAL SCHOOLS. IN ORDER TO SUPPORT CHILDREN AND YOUTH WITH SIGNIFICANT CHALLENGES WE RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PROVIDE ON-GOING COUNSELING AND CASE COORDINATION TO TALENTED AND CARING ADULTS WHO SERVE AS FOSTER PARENTS. OUR FOSTER PARENTS PROVIDE HOMES THAT ARE SAFE, AND SUPPORTIVE. WE AGGRESSIVELY RECRUIT FOSTER PARENTS FROM A DIVERSE POPULATION. WE FOCUS ON CAREFULLY ASSESSING THE STRENGTHS AND NEEDS OF OUR CHILDREN AND MAKING EXCELLENT MATCHES WITH SKILLED FOSTER PARENTS. OUR FOSTER PARENTS ARE EXPERIENCED AND COMPASSIONATE. WE ARE ABLE TO SUPPORT THEIR EFFORTS BY ENSURING THAT THE CHILDREN AND YOUTH ARE RECEIVING ALL OTHER SERVICES THEY NEED FOR THEIR SUCCESS, SUCH AS APPROPRIATE EDUCATIONAL SUPPORTS, PERSONAL OR GROUP COUNSELING OR THERAPY, AND OTHER CASE COORDINATION SERVICES. IN ADDITION, WE ASSIST FOSTER PARENTS IN OBTAINING RESPITE SO THAT THEY CAN BE REFRESHED WHILE THE CHILDREN ARE SAFE AND HAVING THEIR NEEDS MET.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: MARY MCCARTHY PARTICIPATES IN DEFERRED COMP PLAN BUT HAS NOT RECIEVED ANY PAYMENTS TO DATE.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE COMPANY TRANSITIONED ALL SERVICES OUT OF TEXAS AND CURRENTLY DOES NOT HAVE ANY ACTIVE OPERATIONS ELSEWHERE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE SHALL REVIEW AND APPROVE ALL IRS FORM 990 AND 990-PF ANNUAL TAX FILINGS PRIOR TO SUBMISSION, AND THE BOARD SHALL RECEIVE A COPY AND REVIEW ALL IRS FORM 990 AND 990-PF TAX FILINGS WITHIN 30 DAYS OF ITS SUBMISSION.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH DIRECTOR MUST PROVIDE THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITH AN ANNUAL WRITTEN DISCLOSURE OF THE FOLLOWING: (I) THE DIRECTOR'S BUSINESS INVOLVEMENTS WITH THE ORGANIZATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS; (II) THE DIRECTOR'S OTHER BOARD MEMBERSHIPS, WHETHER OF FOR-PROFIT OR NON-PROFIT CORPORATIONS; AND (III) THE TOTAL AMOUNT RECEIVED BY THE DIRECTOR FROM THE ORGANIZATION AND RELATED ORGANIZATIONS FOR SERVICES RENDERED AS A VENDOR OF GOODS OR SERVICES TO THE RELATED ORGANIZATIONS.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CEO AND CFO. COMPENSATION SURVEYS WERE CONDUCTED IN 2008

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
